messages: 1e1954b94dc8c5cd0040fd46a9b0a53a (20:27): any ideas about my "crazy idea" ? have a full tower case and two computers, a P1 and a P3, wanna try move them in the full tower case, is it possible ? also i heard about "linking" two computers (the mainboards)

d95dafefd567e43c341e80ca789b0998 (20:47): i've noticed that my graphics card runs at about 60C idle (kinda hot for idle) but after playing games its like only 2 degrees more, whereas my friend of mines card is like 40-50C idle and 55-60C ingame
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:02): can anyone help me? i got a dualscreen problem on XP
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:02): the DVI socket gives perfect image, but the VGA slot gives blurry image... but when i remove the DVI plug, the VGA slot gives perfect image
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:12): andkore: your friend has the same card?
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:14): Anyone knows when AMD Athlon64 X2 4800+ CPUs for AM2 are available in their EE-Version for endusers?
88c07e4e9458c3e1cfa7bbee30c20207 (21:18): Battery charge: Plugged in - 0% charged (98:40 hours left)
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:20): do you know some things about DualScreen ?
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:23): the DVI socket gives perfect image, but the VGA slot gives blurry image... but when i remove the DVI plug, the VGA slot gives perfect image
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:23): you know what the prob could be?
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:23): (its not the monitor, i made sure of that)
9b84a0dcefb053223e5f052e9334530e (21:26): I'm assuming you mean 'DVI to VGA adaptor' when you say 'DVI plug'
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:27): pheox: is it a dvi-i connector you plug the adaptor in?
9b84a0dcefb053223e5f052e9334530e (21:27): are you booting with two monitors connected? or do you just have one, swapping between ports
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:27): and - maybe it is a driver problem, e.g. nvidia/ati do some wierd stuff sometimes
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:27): pheox: it has to be, otherwise it will naturally never work
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:28): i have the latest driver installed....
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:28): or is there a other one for dual sceen or smth ?

e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:29): pheox: well, your gfx-card needs a DVI-I or DVI-A (extremely seldom) output otherwise you're lost in space with your dvi-to-vga-adaptor which needs an analog signal, with is not provided by dvi-d
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:30): no, there is just one nvidia driver (except certain unofficial ones like opensource or specially tweaked versions9
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:30): right, taking all the letters out improve readability by rather large factor
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:30): i just verified that its a DVI-I
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:30): So then that shouldn't be an issue
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:31): So it's the VGA connection getting blurry?
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:31): 1Operating System: WinXP Home Edition 5.1 Service Pack 2 (Build #2600)
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:31): grml....mirc scripts, that is? damn it :-)
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:31): too lazy to write it all myself :P
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:32): pheox: all windows updates installed? if not, do so. and try to check the driver for special settings.
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:32): linux drivers have quite a few options dedicated to dual screen
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:32): (and btw it works great with here (linux))
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:33): Doesn't sound like an OS issue
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:34): This card previously worked fine with dual screens?
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:34): pheox: what is a "blurry" image?
9b84a0dcefb053223e5f052e9334530e (21:34): It _may_ be a power issue, but then I think nearly everything is a power or airflow issue, so ignore me for the moment (:
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:34): pheox: so it is not a flickering, like with old TVs (not enough Hz)
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:35): like the britness got too high
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:35): and all lines got a white edge
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:36): but it doesnt like like if there is no GFX driver installed
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:36): well - maybe the brightness setting changes, and you just need to correct it with your monitors OSD?
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:36): sounds like either configuration or hardware
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:37): pheox: got another pc where you could build in that card and try out?
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:38): but im too afraid tha this hardware it too good for it >.<
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:39): or a PE-windows? or another windows installation? then it would be clear that it is a hardware or software side issue at least
e06589a0e2bd2d8b5ced22c7981928f4 (21:39): sorry, need to go. byebye and good luck
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:41): not gonna reinstall/install different (my) OS just for a dual screen...
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (21:41): pheox: so simply disconnecting the other cable fixes it?
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:42): but the DVI screen looks better (IF its better, dunno...) so i rather unplug the VGA at this state of mind
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:43): i went to the settings of the prime screen
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:44): and saw this 'sharpness screen' (or anything similair, its written in dutch here...)
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:44): and i dragged it too the right
52556f134b306c305e1d3bfa9b056d49 (21:44): and the screen is hot too
d95dafefd567e43c341e80ca789b0998 (22:10): Hopelessness, no he doesn't have the same card
d95dafefd567e43c341e80ca789b0998 (22:10): i just thought it was weird
